N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5700.5 - Definitions

State Regulations

The following terms as used in this Chapter shall, unless
otherwise expressly stated or unless the context clearly requires a different
interpretation, have the following meaning: (a) Ambulance shall mean a vehicle
specifically designed and equipped for the carrying of the sick or injured, and
clearly marked as such with permanent exterior markings. Commercial ambulance
shall mean an ambulance for hire. (b) Authority shall mean the Ogdensburg

Bridge and Port Authority. (c) Bicycle shall include a velocipede, tricycle, or other light vehicle propelled
by the riders or rider. (d) Bridge
shall include any bridge within the jurisdiction of the authority, but shall
not include the plazas, approaches and highway connections thereto. (e) Bus shall mean a motor vehicle, designed
or used in the transportation of persons, having a seating capacity of 10 or
more persons. (f) Chassis shall mean
the frame and all other mechanical parts of a vehicle, including wheels, but
without body. (g) Driver shall mean
the person who is in actual physical control of a vehicle. (h) Dual vehicles shall mean a truck, tractor, or other self-propelled vehicle in combination with a semitrailer or
trailer. (i) Employee shall mean the
authority official in charge of the bridge or the person performing his
functions and duties for the time being. (j) Motorcycle shall mean all motorized
vehicles registered as a motorcycle, including motor scooters and motor
bicycles. (k) Motor vehicle shall
mean any vehicle driven or propelled by a motor. (l) Operator shall mean the driver or any
person who pushes, draws, propels, operates or is in charge of a
vehicle. (m) Park (or parking) shall
mean the standing of any vehicle on any bridge, approach, roadway or parking
area, or the like, whether occupied or not, otherwise than temporarily for the
purpose of, and while actually and properly engaged in, loading or unloading
merchandise or passengers where permitted. (n) Passenger auto shall mean every type of
motor vehicle used for the transportation of passengers and registered as such, including those rented for hire, but excluding buses. (o) Pedestrian shall mean a person on
foot. (p) Pedestrian crossing shall
mean those portions of the bridge and approaches thereto and terminals
designated as walks or sidewalks on the west (upstream) side and intended for
the use of pedestrians. (q) Police
officer shall mean any officer of the law in the State of New York or Province
of Ontario, including but not limited to New York State Police, sheriffs and
deputies, Royal Canadian Mounted Police and Ontario Provincial Police, acting
within the scope of his authority. (r) Roadway shall mean that part of the
facilities, especially bridges, plazas, approaches and parking areas, designed
and designated for use of motor vehicles. (s) Stop (or stopping) shall mean any
halting, even momentarily, of a vehicle, whether occupied or not, except when
necessary to avoid conflict with other traffic or in compliance with the
direction of any authority employee, any police officer or traffic control
device. (t) Toll shall mean the
bridge crossing toll rate schedule as authorized by the authority. (u) Tractor shall mean a motor vehicle
designed and used for drawing other vehicles but having no provision for
carrying loads independently. (v) Traffic shall mean all pedestrians and vehicles using the facilities. (w) Traffic control device shall mean any
sign, signal, marking or device, whether permanent or temporary, placed or
erected by the authority for the purpose of regulating, warning and guiding
traffic. (x) Trailer (or
semitrailer) shall mean a vehicle without motive power, drawn by a tractor or
other motor vehicle. (y) Truck shall
mean a motor vehicle designed or used primarily for the transportation of
property, except buses, tractors, trailers or semitrailers. (z) Vehicle shall mean any device in, upon or
by which any person or property is or may be transported upon a
roadway. (aa)

Vehicular crossing
shall mean the entire facilities owned or operated by the authority which are
intended to permit the passage of vehicles between Ogdensburg in the United

States and Johnstown in Canada, including but not limited to roadways, bridges, approaches, plazas, parking areas, and portions of customs and immigration
facilities. Notes
